questions.question: Why does EV alone not guarantee good compounding?
options: Because variance/volatility drag and tail risk reduce geometric growth
questions.explanation: Compounding depends on geometric mean; high variance can lower CAGR even with positive EV.

questions.question: A trade wins +10% with p=0.55 and loses −5% with q=0.45. Compute EV of one trade (decimal).
questions.explanation: EV = 0.55*0.10 − 0.45*0.05 = 0.055 − 0.0225 = 0.0325 (If using net profit basis). If using simple expectation of return, 3.25%. (Accept 0.0325±0.002)

questions.question: State one way to improve compounding efficiency without changing EV.
questions.answer_text: Reduce variance (fractional Kelly, diversify, avoid high-vol regimes).
